subject: Re: Running JUnit tests against a .jar file
msgSnippet: Run ant with the -verbose option, and check if your .jar file is added to the path. Maybe, the .jar is not yet available when your path is generated, because
messageBody:
Run ant with the -verbose option, and check if your .jar file is
added to the path.

Maybe, the .jar is not yet available when your path is generated,
because you are creating the jar later in your build?

Regards, Jan

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "D. Lam" <lam.dna@...> wrote:
>
> Are you sure the path to your jar is correct?
> "jar\path\FiletoRunTestAgainst.jar"
>
> Have your class in your jar file do something, anything.
>
>
>
> On 8/30/07, sdny_mo <sdny_mo@...> wrote:
> > --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "David Saff" <saff@> wrote:
> > >
> > > sdny,
> > >
> > > What you have so far appears reasonable on first glance. Can
you use
> > > a similar classpath to run a "main" method from your jar?
> > >
> > > David Saff
> > >
> >
> > I don't know how to do that, currently my code does
nothing...the .jar
> > file isnt loaded so i get a bunch of "package ***** does not
exist"
> > and "cannot find symbol" errors when my tests compile.
> >
> > i'm using ant version 1.6.5 if that makes any difference.
> >
> > Thanks.
> >
> >
>
